WindowRejectionhandled_event.summary: The rejectionhandled event is sent to the script's global scope (usually but also ) whenever a rejected JavaScript {{jsxref("Promise")}} is handled late, i.e. when a handler is attached to the promise after its rejection had caused an event.

remarks.para: This can be used in debugging and for general application resiliency, in tandem with the unhandledrejection event, which is sent when a promise is rejected but there is no handler for the rejection at the time.
